title: Loft 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Dark-colored, full-bodied and practically sweet with oak, this box wine spreads spicy flavors around the fruit, and becomes more syrupy with each sip.

title: Loft 2014 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Apple and honeydew aromas show on the nose of this boxed wine, which prides itself on having a small eco-footprint. The palate is flatter than the nose, with green apple skin flavors but not much texture or acidity to speak of.

title: Albamar 2015 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)
description: Prickly, punchy, pryazinic aromas will have you thinking this is Sauvignon Blanc or Spanish Verdejo. A sharp palate is more about acid than body, while this continues with its SB-like character via green flavors of lime and arugula. A crisp finish evaporates into nothing.

title: Kunza 2012 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Maule Valley)
description: Rustic, gaseous aromas of soupy berry fruits and tire rubber create a struggling nose. Rubbery tannins and a lack of a focal point make for a jumbled palate, while this tastes stewy, weedy and low on fresh fruit.

title: Château Lestrille 2015 Amélia Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: Strawberry-candy aromas are followed onto the palate with a softly textured, muted wine. It has some fruit and acidity although they are too restrained for their own good.

title: Château la Freynelle 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This wine seems neutral in character. The color may be an attractive pale salmon but flavors are muted—only the acidity shows strongly.

title: Jekel 2014 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Barely noticeable aromas of wet rocks and sour red-fruit skins try to show on the nose of this wine. The palate is characterized by iron, wet rocks and dust flavors, without much fruit.

title: Frei Brothers 2014 Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Sweet red cherry, strawberry and smoky charred oak figure most prominently in this robust, full-bodied wine, which opens in a yeasty, baked bread note, and which comes across as somewhat undeveloped.

title: Elqui Wines 2013 Limited Release Pinot Noir (Elqui Valley)
description: If you know Elqui, than this funky wine's murky, stewy, muddy aromas won't come as a shock. In the mouth, this is soft and mushy, with little to no noticeable acidity. Flavors of burnt leaves and stalky berry fruits offer minimal punch, while the finish tastes stewy and rooty, which is nothing unusual for northerly Elqui.

title: Magistrate 2014 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Made to be affordable and easygoing, this is indeed a simple wine, showing light, bright flavors and aromas of apple, cucumber and lime.

title: Porta 2015 Estate Bottled Reserva Pinot Noir (Bío Bío Valley)
description: Cool, herbal aromas of blueberry are unusual. This is blocky in feel, with a low level of finesse. Candied, herbal cherry and medicinal berry flavors finish with mint and spice notes along with a green character.

title: J. Scott Cellars 2014 Viognier (Rogue Valley)
description: A puzzling wine, which bears no resemblance to other examples of this variety. Scents and flavors of vanilla dominate, around flavors of bruised melon, bubble gum and a bit of plastic. Two bottles tasted with similar notes.

title: Jean-Luc Colombo 2015 Cape Bleue Rosé (Mediterranée)
description: Two thirds Syrah and one-third Mourvèdre, this highly aromatic rosé features hints of passion fruit alongside confected, bubblegum flavors balanced by a squirt of lime on the finish. Drink now.

title: Line 39 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Herb aromas and veggie flavors dominate this light-bodied wine. Not much fruit flavor peeks through the herb garden, but the lean white pepper notes and crisp texture are appealing.

title: Viñas del Vero 2013 La Miranda Secastilla Garnacha Blanca (Somontano)
description: Prickly, sweaty aromas of cactus and nettle are not overly attractive. This is weakly built, with hardly any spine. Bland, salty white-fruit flavors finish quick and a touch sour.

title: Dissident 2014 Reserve Red (Curicó Valley)
description: If forced to drink too much of this clumsy, grassy, horsey smelling blend, you might be a dissident, too. This is sticky and cloying on the palate, with sweet, candied, herbal black-fruit flavors that finish under a covering of residual sugar.

title: Bota Box 2014 Riesling (California)
description: Lightly sweet and simply fruity, this wine tastes a bit like peaches and has a gentle texture.

title: Santa Rita 2014 Secret Reserve White (Central Valley)
description: This Riesling-led blend smells pithy and bitter. It's generic and blocky on the palate, with flavors of white mushroom and bitter citrus fruits. Grapefruit pith and orange rind flavors drive the finish. Tasted twice with similar findings.

title: Château de Cornemps 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This wine has an attractive salmon-pink color followed by ripe caramel and spice flavors. The fruit and acidity don't feature as strongly, so the end result is a wine that is fat.

title: Autoritas 2015 Shiraz-Cabernet Rosé (Central Valley)
description: Deep in color, this rosé of Cabernet Sauvignon lacks zip and zest on a lazy nose. A chunky, grabby mouthfeel gives off the sensation of grape skins, while this tastes a bit foxy and herbal, with little to no fruit character.

title: Bitácora 2014 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Monotone aromas of apple and citrus are stalky and suggest that this is in decline. Mild citrus flavors are stalky like the nose, while this finishes with pithy, bitter notes of lemon.

title: Feudi del Pisciotto 2015 Baglio di Sole Inzolia (Terre Siciliane)
description: This is extremely lean and acrid, with flavors of yellow apple skin and bitter walnut but no fruit richness.

title: Veuve du Vernay NV Ice Demi-Sec Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)
description: This is a fresh, aromatic wine with off-dry white fruit flavors. Made to be drunk with ice, it is less fruity and more softly textured with a light tang and considerable acidity. Drink now.

title: Kunza 2014 Merlot (Maule Valley)
description: Cherry and plum aromas lack purity and turn more earthy, horsey and unclean upon airing. Sharp, cutting acidity creates and jagged palate, while flavors of sour black plum and cherry finish with saucy notes on a choppy, short finish.

title: Indomita 2015 Duette Premium Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)
description: Rubbery, resiny aromas are borderline unpleasant. This feels heavy and cidery, while stalky, pickled, woody flavors dominate. An oaky, briny tasting finish leaves little room for platitudes.

title: Indomita 2015 Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)
description: A heavily pickled-smelling nose includes aromas of sea brine and vinegar. Narrow on the palate, this SB tastes of sour tangerine and green beans. Salty, briny and tart on the finish, with a note of yellow mustard.

title: Château Gandoy Perrinat 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: Herbal and spicy, this wine has bitter vegetal flavors that don't accord with the acidity or texture.

title: Campos Góticos 2013 Roble 12 Meses  (Ribera del Duero)
description: By now it's known that 2013 was a cold, tough, miserly vintage in most of Spain, RDD included. But this horsey, funky number goes beyond vintage conditions. It's unfocused, citric, leafy and green, with a hammering finish. Bottom line: this is not what you want from Ribera del Duero.

title: Veranda 2015 Chardonnay (Bío Bío Valley)
description: Aromas of burnt wood, saline solution and mealy fruit do not impress. This feels both resiny and acidic, while flavors of oak and salty white fruits finish with a final coating of unappealing oak.

title: Finca Patagonia 2015 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)
description: Yeasty, pyrazinic aromas are strained and less than clean. This feels chunky, with moderate acidic cut. Generic citrus flavors quickly turn bitter, while the finish is weak in constitution, an indication that this has nowhere to go but down.
